required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of ABBV-951 in Subjects With Parkinson's Disease (PD)
clinical_study.official_title: A 52-Week, Open-label, Single-arm Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of 24-hour Daily Exposure of Continuous Subcutaneous Infusion of ABBV-951 in Subjects With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of ABBV-951 in subjects with Parkinson's disease (PD).

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of CSCI through 30 days after last infusion device is removed (up to 56 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent adverse events defined as any adverse event from the initiation of CSCI through 30 days after last infusion device is removed

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events of Special Interest
primary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of CSCI through 30 days after last infusion device is removed (up to 56 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent adverse events of special interest defined as any adverse event of polyneuropathy or weight loss from the initiation of CSCI through 30 days after last infusion device is removed

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with numeric grade equal to or higher than 5 and with letter grade equal to or higher than D on the Infusion Site Evaluation Scale
primary_outcome.description: The Infusion Site Evaluation Scale will be used to assess infusion sites.

primary_outcome.description: The change from baseline to end of study will be assessed for clinical laboratory tests.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Abnormal Electrocardiogram (ECG) Results
primary_outcome.description: ECG recordings will be evaluated as 'normal' or 'abnormal'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average normalized daily "Off" time and "On" times: Change from Baseline to end of study
secondary_outcome.description: Average normalized daily "Off" time and "On" times as assessed by the Parkinson's Disease (PD) Diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Parkinson's Disease (PD) symptoms: Change from Baseline to end of study
secondary_outcome.description: PD symptoms will be assessed by the Movement Disorder Society-Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (MDS- UPDRS) Parts I-IV (or the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale [UPDRS] Parts I-V where a validated translation of the MDS-UPDRS is not available).

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Assessed by the Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire-39 Items (PDQ-39): Change from Baseline to end of study
secondary_outcome.description: The PDQ-39 is used to measure aspects of health that are relevant to subjects with PD, and which may not be included in general health status questionnaires.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep symptoms as assessed by the Parkinson's Disease Sleep Scale-2 (PDSS-2): Change from Baseline to end of study
secondary_outcome.description: The PDSS-2 is used to characterize the various aspects of nocturnal sleep problems in patients with PD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Assessed by EuroQol 5 Dimensions 5 Levels (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score: Change from Baseline to End of Study
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a standardized instrument used to measure health-related quality of life that can be used in a wide range of health conditions and treatments.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive ABBV-951 by continuous subcutaneous infusion (CSCI) for 52 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with diagnosis of idiopathic Parkinson's Disease (PD) that is levodopa -responsive
- Subjects must be judged by the investigator to be inadequately controlled by current therapy, have recognizable/identifiable "Off" and "On" states (motor fluctuations), and have a minimum of 2.5 hours of "Off" time per day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is cognitively impaired and is not able to safely and effectively manage the drug delivery system and the diaries and is not able to adhere to the study.
- Subject is considered by the investigator to be an unsuitable candidate to receive ABBV-951 for any reason.

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
